item.title: Report X-2023060660
item.description:
Report X-2023060660

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-29
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions. Upon inspection, the package containing "Medivators Rapicide PA High Level Disinfectant" was found that 1 of the 4 plastic gallons had a missing/loose cap. The cap was found at the bottom of the package. The contents was then placed into a lined salvage drum for further processing. DescribePack: the package failure was due to a cap the became loose and ended at the bottom of the package container (Box). It cause 1/4 of the gallon to leak its contents. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was opened and placed into a lined salvage drum to contain further leakage. The cap was placed on tightly after being found and remaining bottles were checked for slightly loose caps.

item.title: Report X-2023060652
item.description:
Report X-2023060652

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-27
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THR OVER NIGHT SORT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE WITH OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION IT SHOWS THAT A JAR OF ECOLAB SOLID POWER XL (EXTENDED LIFE DISHMACHINE DETERGENT) WAS PUNCTURED AND ONE WAS ALSO MISSING FROM THE BOX. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WAS PLACED IN A LINED SALAVGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS CAUSED DUE A PUNCTURE OF THE JARS. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS HURRIEDLY PLACED INTO A LINED SALAVGE DRUM FOR FURTHER INSPECTION SINCE THERE WAS OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023060524
item.description:
Report X-2023060524

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING SORT, PACKAGE OBSERVED WET & OILY.INSPECTION CONFIRMED THAT AND INNER BOTTLE OF TECHRON FUEL CLEANER'S TOP CAME OFF AND LEAKED THROUGHOUT BOX. WE INDENTIFED THAT LEAKER WAS NOT THE HAZMAT, HOWEVER, BASED ON INSPECTION, WE IDENTIFIED THAT SHIPPER INCLUDED 12 AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAY PAINT. THE SPRAY PAINT WERE ENCLOSED IN INNER CASES WHICH WERE IDENTIFED AS HAZMAT WITH LIMITED QTY DECALS. DescribePack: DURING SORT, PACKAGE OBSERVED WET & OILY.INSPECTION CONFIRMED THAT AND INNER BOTTLE OF TECHRON FUEL CLEANER'S TOP CAME OFF AND LEAKED THROUGHOUT BOX. WE INDENTIFED THAT LEAKER WAS NOT THE HAZMAT, HOWEVER, BASED ON INSPECTION, WE IDENTIFIED THAT SHIPPER INCLUDED 12 AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAY PAINT. THE SPRAY PAINT WERE ENCLOSED IN INNER CASES WHICH WERE IDENTIFED AS HAZMAT WITH LIMITED QTY DECALS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE SEPARATED FROM OTHER SORT ITEMS & PLACED WITHIN IN A HAZMAT BAG AND BIN

item.title: Report X-2023060517
item.description:
Report X-2023060517

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the Overnight sort a package was brought to the hazmat cage with obvious signs of internal leakage. Upon further inspection it shows that a bottle of "DIOXANE" was fully leaked out that caused the package to wet internal and external. The remaining content was placed in a lined salvage drum to be scrapped or otherwise. DescribePack: The package failed due to being mishandled, it fell while loading and the bottle inside was cracked. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in lined salvage drum to maintain the remaining liquid and cracked bottle pieces.

item.title: Report E-2023060149
item.description:
Report E-2023060149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: Bridgeton
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Winchester & Western Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipper loaded tank car (TC) overnight, 5/15/23 and was shipping it out today to a private storage facility. This TC car was offered into transportation on 5/16/23. During a regular HM inspection, the TC was discovered leaking auto refrigeration, observed on B end liquid eduction valve. The FRA HM Inspector did not open bonnet cover but accessed the valve through the opening in the wall pf protective housing. He safely climbed down the left side ladder to make his notifications. The HM is described as 1 Tank Car, 152,250 pounds of UN 3220, Pentafluoroethane, Class: 2.2. The TC was in a train just outside the shipper's gate, the railroad was switching out plant. The rail crew put leaking TC back into shipper's facility for repair. The shipper will re-weigh the TC to determine if any measurable quantity was lost.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 15, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3082 released approximately 0.125 gallons of product to the trailer interior due to a faulty nozzle. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel tightened the nozzle and deployed absorbents to contain the leakage. The crew removed the damaged tote and transferred the contents into one (1) 275-gallon tote. The damaged tote was cut up and contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All remaining UN3082 impacted waste was contained in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2023051238
item.description:
Report X-2023051238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During sort package observed leaking wet. Inspection confirmed inner contents leaking. inner item 5 gallon drum of interior 2K acrylic polyurethane. Package is a regulated Hazmat. 5 gallon drum bent which is causing the leak. Leak cannot be corrected. Minimizing leak by keeping drum upright. DescribePack: Outer package wet due to leak from with the outer package. Inner package is a 5 gal drum which is dented & bent at several placed near the top of the can. No inner packing or partition used to protect or brace drum from possible impacts during shipping. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was separated from other sort packages and placed in a hazmat bag and bin.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 11, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing Nugen NR Disinfectant Wipe Concentrate (UN160) was punctured by a skid steer and released approximately one-half gallon (0.5) of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack. The crew then deployed granular absorbents and utilized hand tools to containerize all Nugen NR Disinfectant Wipe Concentrate impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

THE REMAINS WILL BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHER WISE BY DISPOSITION ORDER.

item.title: Report E-2023050435
item.description:
Report E-2023050435

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: BURLINGTON TOWNSHIP
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 2, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of sulfuric acid (UN2796) and one (1) 275-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide (UN1824) were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product total to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel transferred the sulfuric acid into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. The crew then replaced the lid on the 275-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide. ES utilized absorbent wipes to wipe down the impacted totes, then containerized all impacted absorbent wipes in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023050240
item.description:
Report E-2023050240

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T03:09:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: CARLSTADT
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 4, 2023, at 1652 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Carlstadt, New Jersey regarding the release of approximately 50 gallons of Phosphoric Acid 85% (Phosphoric acid, solution, UN1805, 8, III) from (9) 275-gallon plastic totes. The release was reportedly due to a a number of factors, including loose bungs and punctures during transit. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. Waste generated for this response included (8) empty 55-gallon poly drums previously containing released product, (9) empty 275-gallon plastic totes, (12) 275-gallon plastic totes of phosphoric acid product, (3) 55-gallon poly drums containing phosphoric acid impacted PPE, Oil Dri and soda ash, and (1) 55-gallon poly drum of phosphoric acid impacted rinse water. All waste was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • City: MERCERVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XTJ called ERTS to report a 20-gallon spill of UN1993 "ZEP BRAKE FLUSH VOC_L&K_53GL" from a 53-gallon metal drum that was caused by a dock worker clipping the drum against other freight during dock operations and impacting their dock floor near door 27. ERTS dispatched a contractor due to the volume of material released. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product had released from the drum. When crew arrived, the terminal personnel had already patched the drum and cleaned the released product. The impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors containerized the damaged drum into an 85-gallon metal overpack. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the overnight sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible signs of internal leakage. The package was placed into a hazmat bag to contain any further leaks and odor for further inspection. Upon inspection, two 2.5 Liter glass bottles were discovered 1 of the 2 bottles containing "Fisher Scientific Toluene" was found cracked causing the internal leakage. The items were placed into a salvage drum to possibly partially scrap and return the remaining to the shipper, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to being dropped during the unloading process. One of the two 2.5 Liters glass bottles was completely cracked, total internal leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed into a hazmat bag upon arrival to contain further leaks and strong odors.

The puncture was likely caused by a mishap in the unloading process when going through the rollers/belts. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upside down into a salvage bag & drum to stop any further leakage once inspected.

ADDITIONALLY QA IDENTIFIED THAT THE CONTENT IS A HAZMAT BUT THERE ARE NO HZMT DECAL OR IDENTIFIERS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS AN INNER BOX THAT HAS AN OUTDATED ORMD DECAL BUT AGAIN IT IS OUTDATED AND ALSO ONLY ON THE INNER BOX AND NOT THE OUTER BOX DescribePack: UNSTABLE CAPS OR CLOSURES AND NO HAZMAT DECALS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE IDENTIFIED AS A HAZMAT, THE PACKAGE WA SSEPARATED FROM OTHER PACKAGES AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND BIN.

  • City: DOVER

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING SORT PACKAGE OBSERVED RIPPED/TORN W/ INNER CONTENT EXPOSED.INSPECTION CONFIRMED SHIPPER PACKED AEROSOL CANS IN A BOX WITHOUT HZMT DECAL.ALSO, THEY ONLY USED MINIMAL PACKING IN THE FORM OF PAPER AND PLACED IN AN OVERSIZE/ OUT OF PROPORTION BOX. AS A RESULT BOX COULD NOT MAINTAIN STRUCTURE AND GOT CRUSHED AND TORN. INNER CANS SHIFTED INSIDE DUE TO EXCESS ROOM CAUSING THEM TO SMASH TOGETHER AND BREAK OFF NOZZLES. DescribePack: DURING SORT PACKAGE OBSERVED RIPPED/TORN W/ INNER CONTENT EXPOSED.INSPECTION CONFIRMED SHIPPER PACKED AEROSOL CANS IN A BOX WITHOUT HZMT DECAL.ALSO, THEY ONLY USED MINIMAL PACKING IN THE FORM OF PAPER AND PLACED IN AN OVERSIZE/ OUT OF PROPORTION BOX. AS A RESULT BOX COULD NOT MAINTAIN STRUCTURE AND GOT CRUSHED AND TORN. INNER CANS SHIFTED INSIDE DUE TO EXCESS ROOM CAUSING THEM TO SMASH TOGETHER AND BREAK OFF NOZZLES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE IDENTIFIED AS A HZMT, THE PACKAGE WAS SEPARATED FROM OTHER PACKAGES IN THE SORT AND PLACED IN A HZMT BIN & BAG FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report E-2023030387
item.description:
Report E-2023030387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-16
  • City: CINNAMINSON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 16, 2023, at 1000 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal XCJ experienced a 5-gallon release of UN1263 “Certi-Vex AC 1315 Super Seal HG” from a 5- gallon metal drum due to a puncture caused by other freight. No soils, drains, or waterways were impacted. ERTS dispatched Hepaco for cleanup operations. On March 16, 2023, at 1150 ET, Hepaco arrived on site and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 3’ area of the concrete lot below the trailer. Hepaco confirmed the pail was punctured by adjacent freight. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The empty damaged pail was containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a separate 55-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

It was not reported how the hole formed on the bottom of the drum. shipment was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for return travel as FedEx policy does not allow for salvage packages to travel internationally.

  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 55-Gallon metal drum and a box containing (6) - (16)oz bottles arrived punctured/crushed and leaking. The drum was laying on it's side on the skid and arrived punctured by a piece of dunnage, the box was crushed by the drum. The drum released about (2)gal and the box released about (21)oz. They are holding (1) box containing (3) - smaller boxes impacted by the release from the drum and crushed and leaking. (2) boxes each contain (6) - (16)oz bottles and (1) box contains (4) - (16)oz cans. In total, 2.25 G released. The spill was cleaned. All materials and containers were placed into overpacks for proper disposal.

  • Description: On February 3, 2023, ERTS was contacted by Landstar personnel in Monroe Township, New Jersey regarding the release of Retail Clean-In-Place Oven Cleaner (Potassium hydroxide, solution, UN1814, 8, II) from (1) 2.5-gallon plastic jug, reportedly due to a forklift puncture. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, neutralizer and the proper PPE. The damaged jug, impacted cargo, spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (3) 55-gallon plastic drums. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

This probably came to happen from a small protruding item during the unloading process. The jerrycan was immediately placed into a lined salvage drum to collect and spillage and for further processing. DescribePack: The jerrycan failure was a puncture towards the bottom of the jerrycan. Its a slight gash barely noticeable, which caused a slow leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The jerrycan was immediately placed into a lined salvage drum to collect any spillage. Due to the location of the gash it was impossible of placing the item a way where it can be partially saved.

  • Description: 1. X-2023010405 SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking after being unloaded from a trailer. It was placed in a bag and brought to the hazmat cage in a tote. DescribePack: The package was a fiberboard box containing 4 bottles of isopropyl alcohol. One bottle leaked entirely due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat tote initially, and after being processed was sealed in a drum. All spillage was contained using absorbent material. 2. X-2023010406 SequenceEvent: The package was found damaged when being held for processing. It was placed in a hazmat tote and brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package was a fiberboard box containing 4 bottles of isopropyl alcohol. One bottle leaked slightly due to a loose cap. The exterior of the package showed no signs of damage, and amount of spillage was minimal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat tote and after processing sealed in a salvage drum to contain spillage.

  • Description: On December 30, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was forked and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental, LLC (FCE) to complete the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. Then, the crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to containerize all UN1263-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022120686
item.description:
Report X-2022120686

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. Upon inspection 1 can containing "Sunnyside Denatured Alcohol, Alcohol Appliance & Marine Stove Fuel" was found with a loose cap causing the can to leak out about half of the product. The package will be returned to the shipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap and the can leaked out half on the "Sunnyside Denatured Alcohol, Alcohol Appliance & Marine Stove Fuel". Loose cap most Likely from the pressure of a drop or it wasn't closed properly by shipper. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed upright and placed into a salvage bag to ease the effects of leakage. The package was then inspected and found with a loose cap and closed it back up tightly to send back to the shipper unless otherwise.

item.title: Report E-2022120149
item.description:
Report E-2022120149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-18
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1446 EST, XPO notified ERTS of rejected cargo located at XSD. It was reported that a 375-gallon poly tote of UN2735 “3,3-Methylenebis(5-methyloxazolidine)” was rejected by the consignee due to unknown reasons. The Tote was found on OS&D and leaked approximately 1-teaspoon of the product at the spout area due to a possible damaged tote or a seal leak. The terminal requested a contractor out to inspect the tote for damages. ERTS dispatched a contractor for assessment. Contractors arrived onsite and advised were a few drops of liquid under the spout of the tote which they pH tested at a 9. Crew advised it didn't look like there is was damage to the tote. The material was transferred into a new tote as precaution. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110612
item.description:
Report E-2022110612

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-10
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 11/10/2022, at 10:48 hours, CSX personnel in the CSXT Manville yard discovered the SHPX222814, a residue tank car of UN 1993 Waste Flammable Liquid, having a vapor release from the manway area of the rail car. The rail car was isolated and GEOCYCLE was notified along with Kemtell (no report # issued). MEI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the tank car was having a vapor release from the manway area of the rail car. Upon checking the manway gasket. The gasket was found to be improperly installed and cracked. The issue identified where corrected and were communicated to the shipper Marvin Sparks 843-826-1746 marvin.sparks@geocycle.com . Contractor personnel installed new nozzle gasket secured the rail car. The rail car was released to transportation. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package was brought over to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. The box was wet and breaking apart from being soaked. Upon inspection 1 out of 4 plastic bottles of "Lysol brand I.C. Quaternary Disinfectant Cleaner" was found with a loose cap causing the internal leakage. The package was then placed in a salvage drum to await disposition and to be returned to the sipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to the closure cap of the plastic bottle being loose most likely from being dropped or mishandled. The bottle didn't have any seal so being that it had it loose cap the product leaked out almost entirely leaving only a small amount inside the bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The packaged was immediately placed upright and opened for inspection. Upon inspection the package was placed in a salvage bag and into a salvage drum to await disposition.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with obvious signs of internal leakage. Upon inspection, the 5 gallon drum containing "FIBERBOND SPRAY TYPE CEMENT" was found completely covered in product and leaked out covering the drum and the box used to package the item. The lid of the drum seemed to have been out of place leading to cause the internal leakage. The package was placed into a salvage drum lined to await disposition for scrapping, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure is the out of place lid sealing the drum. The package contains a metal lid sealing the drum and seems like the package was dropped causing part of the lid to lift up and cause the complete internal leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed upright and into a lined salvage drum for further inspection, since the damage came from the top lid area.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING THE PM SORT OPERATIONS AT THE FEDEX EXPRESS HUB IN NEWARK, NJ A FIBERBOARD BOX WAS OBSERVED LEAKING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE BOX CONTAINED A PLASTIC BOTTLE OF UN1197 EXTRACTS, FLAVORING, LIQUID PG III, WHICH LEAKED OUT INTO THE OUTER PACKAGING. FOLLOWING THE SPILL CLEANUP THE INVOLVED PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELD PENDING FURTHER DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE MARKED LIMITED QUANTITY. SENT UP MANUAL TOWERS THEN DROPPED DOWN CHUTE AS PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED LEAKING. PACKAGE SAT FOR ABOUT 10 MINUTES BEFORE QA WAS NOTIFIED AND DISCOVERED CONTENTS. PLACED ABSORBANT PADS ON FLOOR, PUT ENTIRE PACKAGE INTO PLASTIC BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. BROUGHT TO VENTILATED AREA TO PROCESS, INCLUDING CLEANING MATERIALS. DescribePack: CAPS ON 3 BOTTLES LOOSE AND NEARLY COMING OFF. BOTTLES LEAK STEADILY WHEN TILTED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN FRONT OF FAN TO REDIRECT FUMES WHILE PROCESSING. PUT INSIDE PLASTIC BAG AND RED TOTE THAT WILL BE BROUGHT TO LOCKED HAZMAT CAGE. WORE PPE TO MINIMIZE SKIN EXPOSURE DURING CLEANING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the overnight sort a package was brought to the hazmat cage showing signs of internal leakage. Half of the package was soiled, which we carefully placed inside two totes to bring to investigate it. DescribePack: Upon further inspection 1 bottle of Getinge clean stainless steel chamber cleaner cap was loose and spilled out. After my investigation I concluded that that the package had a loose cap and leaked out. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The content cap was properly sealed (not leaking) and the remaining caps were checked as well. the contents & remains were repacked in a salvage drum to be ready to be sent back to the shipper, unless otherwise by the disposition order.

The package was immediately placed into a salvage drum lined with a plastic bag for further inspection. Upon inspection, the package containing "THERMO FISHER ACETONITRILE" was found cracked which caused the internal leakage. The package will be scrapped, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to being most likely dropped as the whole bottle was shattered into pieces causing the acetonitrile to completely leak out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: the package was immediately placed into a salvage drum lined with a hazmat plastic bag upright to inspect right away.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the Overnight Sort a Hazmat package was brought to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. Upon further inspection the package was place in a hazardous plastic bag then placed in a salvage drum. Further inspection shows that 2 cans of Acetona was damaged, one had a dent that cause leakage the other cap was loose that also caused internal leakage to the package. The remaining contents will be returned to shipper unless told otherwise on disposition. DescribePack: Failure of package was cause by a loose cap on one of the Acetona can causing leakage of 3/4 of the content to spill, also a dent in the other can causing all of the gallon to spill completely. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed in a hazardous plastic then placed in a salvage drum to stop further leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 2X1GALLON (PLASTIC BOTTLES) VAXXEN LABS ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL 99 % EACH BOTTLE HAS A LOOSE CAP AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 10% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking during the preload sort. It was contained in a hazmat tote and QA became notified. DescribePack: The package was a fiberboard box containing 2 paint cans of black WWII paint. Both cans were found slightly dented and open resulting in leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic bag inside a hazmat tote and after being processed became sealed in a salvage drum. Spilled paint was cleaned up using absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2022090827
item.description:
Report X-2022090827

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-01
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package was brought over to the hazmat cage with signs of internal leakage. The package was then placed in a salvage drum lined with a plastic bag for further inspection. Upon inspection, one bottle of four containing " SWAN 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL" was found with a loose cap compromising the seal and causing the internal leakage. The package will be returned to the shipper unless told otherwise on disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was caused by a loose cap that compromised the seal on the plastic bottle which caused internal leakage. The bottle leaked about 3/4 of the "SWAN 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL". DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed upright into a salvage drum lined with a hazmat bag to collect any possible further leakage and further inspection.

  • Description: This fibreboard box was found to have leaked on the belt. Exact cause of spill unknown. The package may have dropped during the sort. Standard spill cleanup procedures were followed and the package was contained in a FedEx salvage package (drum) pending final disposition.

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-08
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink (contains UN1210) was crushed during transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior, cargo, and concrete surface beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surfaces, then all impacted material was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

  • Description: During boarding of UA999, customer [REDACTED] in 49B advised her laptop battery was very hot FA Hookey noted it was an apple MacBook, but unsure of which model Customer was concerned the battery may cause an issue during the flight due to the overheating The FAs who responded obtained the TCB and place the device inside as a precaution. The FAs then notified the International Purser Hookey who then notified the captain A CSR was on the aircraft assisting with boarding and spoke with customer [REDACTED] to obtain all information The FAs handed the TCB to the CSR in the moment MX replaced the TCB prior to departure No other firefighting procedures were needed as no smoke/flames/sparks were present
